title: Bug 47910: ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF
description: When using the 'outjar' option with ajc, the resulting jar file is missing the MANIFEST.MF file even though there is a METAINF/MANIFEST.MF file inside the source directory.
OB: When I call ajc with the 'sourceroots' option followed by 'outjar' option and specify an output file with a .jar extension, the resulting file is created successfully. However, when I try to open the file, it fails to load as a valid jar file because there is no MANIFEST.MF file present inside.
EB: After using the 'outjar' option with ajc, the resulting file should be a valid jar file with a MANIFEST.MF file included.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Run the command 'ajc sourceroots <mydir> outjar <my.jar>' where <mydir> is the source directory containing the METAINF/MANIFEST.MF file.
2. Verify that an output file named <my.jar> is created.
3. Attempt to open the <my.jar> file and observe that it is not recognized as a valid jar file due to the absence of the MANIFEST.MF file.
